abstract: Alan D. Schwartz may have a broad range of career choices, now that he has decided to leave JPMorgan Chase. But according to The New York Post, the former Bear Stearns chief executive won’t go without a spot reserved for a longtime lieutenant.
lead_paragraph: Alan D. Schwartz may have a broad range of career choices, now that he has decided to leave JPMorgan Chase. But according to The New York Post, the former Bear Stearns chief executive won’t go without a spot reserved for a longtime lieutenant.

headline.main: Schwartz Job Must Include Spot for Lieutenant, Report Says
